Others: The Westfallonstadion in Dortmund is known for its electrifying atmosphere
Germany flew under the radar a little ahead of the tournament but has been unbeaten so far
Julian Nagelsmann's side has gone unbeaten and qualified for the knockout stages
Rising stars like Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala are leading the team
Toni Kroos is playing his swan song
Germany has a real belief in winning a record fourth Euros triumph
Denmark has an unbeaten record but has only scored twice and has not won a game
Denmark needs to find another gear to cause an upset
This match is in the round of 16
Germany v Denmark will take place on Saturday 29th June 2024
The match will kick off at 8pm
Germany v Denmark will be shown live on ITV1 with live coverage from 7:15pm
The match can also be live streamed online via ITVX
Listeners can tune into the match on BBC Radio 5 Live
The match odds are: Germany (3/5), Draw (29/10), Denmark (5/1)
